Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Bree
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a wedding gift for our best friends. The reason we chose this item was because it was damage resistant and bright to find if set down outside. {The bride lost her first camera, so we needed something to help combat that.}They took it to Cancun and had it in and out of the water for 7 days straight. The camera freezes if it goes past 10 feet, they learned, but if you follow the cleaning instructions, it'll come out unscathed. Which to me, is amazing and totally worth the money!It has several features they've found awesome and helpful, the slideshow when looking for a specific picture, the option to take several pictures at once and have it merged together as one was another.The reason for only 4 stars is the battery life. The camera dies after about 150 pictures, and that is honestly a downer. Especially if you want to take it anywhere that you'll be snapping several pictures...usually vacations.However the quality of the photos, the amazing durability of the camera, and the fun color options, can outweigh the one negative. Just charge it often, or buy a second battery to keep as a backup.I am going to buy one for myself, I'm that sold on it!

Reviews.Title: Truly Tough
Reviews.Author: Scott Edward Larosa
Reviews.Content: This'll be my third model and fifth camera of the Stylus Tough series.  Already had this same one for six months, took it too deep skin diving.  NOT a dive camera, but truly tough and weatherproof.  I've lost three cause they go where a camera should not go.  A high end card helps a lot with recycle speed.  I'm trying orange to help with losing it problem.  If you've ever drowned a camera in the rain or ruined one with dirt, think about this one- it's impervious, I would hand it to a three year old in a mud puddle!

Reviews.Title: Wish things could have been different...
Reviews.Author: Love New Orleans
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take on a cruise to the Bahamas.  Took a couple of pictures before the trip just to make sure it worked, and all seemed good.The first 5 days of the cruise (including 2 snorkeling expeditions where I didn't get near to 10 feet underwater), it worked great.  Good color rendition, and the panoramic feature was so much more simple than other point-and-shoot digital cameras that I have had.  The pictures were nice, and it worked great under water.  Sadly, towards the end of the 5th day, the view screen stopped working. It would come on for a couple of seconds and then go blank.  I recharged the battery a couple of times, and even tried our spare battery, but that didn't help.The camera didn't leak in the battery compartment, so if it was caused by water leaking in, it came from some other part of the camera.Fortunately, we had our Kodak digital camera with us on the trip, so we were still able to take lots of pictures of the Bahamas and Key West.Sadly, the Olympus went back to the store for a refund.  If it couldn't hold up on a fairly tame cruise, I just couldn't justify getting a new one for potential future vacations like white water rafting that I would want a waterproof, shock-friendly camera for.I have a good Canon DSLR for serious photography.  We bought this camera to take snapshots on the cruise, and for future vacations.  The camera has nice features, and worked great while it worked.  Sadly, since it didn't last 5 full days, I really wouldn't recommend buying one.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Buy!
Reviews.Author: Portia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and floating case prior to a cruise with some friends and it is WORTH EVERY PENNY.  We swam with stingrays, snorkeled, explored caves, kayaked, and hung out in the pool and got terrific pictures without having to worry about damaging the camera.  Features are easy-to-use and can also do panoramic photos; battery life is a bit limited but I solved this by buying a second battery--extremely afforadable on Amazon.  Takes great pictures EVEN UNDERWATER (I used a 8gig memory card and saved all photos on the highest resolution so they'll print out suitable for hanging up at home later) and good indoor/non adventure kind of pictures.  Downside: lengthy time between when you push the button and when the photo actually takes.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Naya1229
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Olympus TG-310 on a cruise when I dropped a broke my camera.  It was my first waterproof camera and I was really impressed with the price and what it could do.  WARNING:  Make sure to LOCK the camera when you are using it in and under water.  I did not and the second day of owning it I got it filled with salt water and couldn't use it for the rest of the trip.  Thankfully, Olympus stayed true to their warranty and when I arrived home from the cruise sent it in to get fixed, free of charge.  Good company and good camera!  Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great compact waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Anhtuan Phan
Reviews.Content: I rated this camera 5 stars because I was looking for a waterproof, compact camera that takes decent pictures.  This camera does all of that.  I'm not comparing it with a full size digital SLR.  And for under $140 with free shipping from Amazon, it's a good deal.I bought this camera for a trip to the Caribbean.  It was in the water several times, up to 4 feet deep.  It worked flawlessly and stayed bone dry.  Be sure to rinse it in clean tap water, wait for it to dry completely before opening.The shell is aluminum which makes it heavy duty.  The exposures and colors are fairly accurate even indoors with flash.  Sharpness is adequate for this type of camera.  I'm particularly impressed with the quality of the pictures in the macro mode.  There are 2 things that I don't like:1. In the battery saving mode, the screen turns off after only about 2 seconds, making it a little annoying.  To turn it back on, you press lightly on the shutter release.  You can turn off this mode but cannot extend the time.2. It does not come with an external battery charger.  The battery has to be charged while inside the camera.  I solved this problem by buying an external charger from eBay.  You may also consider getting a second battery for convenience.The controls are small so if you have big fingers or wear gloves, you may have difficulty.  But again, this is a compact camera that fits in your shirt pocket.The manufacturer says that you need to replace the waterproof seal once a year but that's true for all waterproof cameras.  I find that the seal will last a longer if you leave the battery door open during storage.  That way there's not constant pressure on the seal.I purchased this camera at the same time as the Panasonic Lumix TS3.  Although both cameras are about the same, the Olympus' pictures are a lot sharper that of the Panasonic.  I was surprised because the Panasonic had a Leica lens and cost more.  Figure that!

Reviews.Title: Had Such High Hopes
Reviews.Author: AzraelX7
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two specific reasons.  First, I have owned an Olympus FE-280 for a long time and taken well over 50,000 pictures with it.  Until recently, I've never had a problem with that camera, and even now it's still excellent 90% of the time.  The FE-280 was left out in the rain once, and washed in the washing machine after being left in a pocket, and both times it came out with no damage.  Second, I took a vacation to Puerto Rico earlier this summer, and knew I'd be taking the camera to the beach, snorkeling and kayaking, etc.  I wanted a camera that would take awesome pics and be able to stand up to some abuse.First, let me say that I love the picture quality and features included with this camera.  The pictures were always sharp, in focus and with excellent color reproduction.  Video and sound quality with this camera were also very good.  The other features, such as photo modes, panoramic, etc are all excellent and easy to use.  I particularly like the super macro mode.  You can get in really close for some very pretty shots.  The advanced adjustment features let you control many aspects of your shooting.  Not as much as a DSLR, but more so than many point and shoot cameras.That said, one of the primary reasons I wanted this camera was for it's waterproofing.  This turned out to be it's only major failure.  There is a door on the side of the camera for access to battery and memory card slots, as well as USB and HDMI ports.  The door has a rubber seal and lock, but it's weak point is the hinge.  This is where the leakage occured in my camera.  It was never much, but in sensitive electronic devices, a drop is all it takes.  About half way through our vacation, my wife and I discovered that water was leaking in.  It would cause the camera to unexpectedly shut off or become completely inoperable.  Salt water also corroded the contacts inside the HDMI port, rendering it unusable.  If we set the camera out and let it dry, it would be fine and continue working after a couple hours.  But who wants to put a vacation on hold to wait for a camera to get working?  Luckily, we also brought the old 280 and my Canon 60D DSLR, so we had plenty of opportunities to take lots of pics.So, if this had been a normal, non-water proof camera, I would rate it 5 stars across the board.  As I mentioned above, picture, video, sound and feature quality are great.  As of right now, we've sent the camera in for warranty service.  We'll see how that works out.  I will post an update later to see how the camera is after that.Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Great Product...so far
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the money.  So far I have taken some amazing underwater pictures, which is really what I bought it for, but it happens to do a lot more than I even knew it could.  The panaoramic features and all of the "magic" features is has are really amazing.  Wish it could take pictures in deeper water, but for the price, I guess its limitations are reasonable.So far everyone who has seen my underwater pics and the camera wants one when I tell them how affordable it is.

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-310 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: anelson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend for kayaking and she loves it.  She hasn't touched her 12 MP Olympus Stylus since she got this.  She loves all of the extra modes to take pictures in, like the watercolor, drawing or panorama modes.  It's been dropped multiple times and seen it's fair share of water and still works like new.  We've seen other reviews stating that the buttons are stiff and clumsy to push but we didn't have a problem with them.  I would definitely recommend this camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: J. Wehrheim "Product Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Holden Beach. Tested the video and pictures at home first and all was good. I kept this camera in my pocket on the beach and got some great pics and video of the kids playing in the water. That lasted two days. On day 3 it started to malfunction and the screen was just glowing - no video or menus. I noticed condensation behind the LCD. Water had seeped behind the LCD screen and the thing died. I was never in the water over my head. I'm 5'10" and only think I'm 10' tall! It was a great concept for 48 hours and I love the pictures and video I got in those 2 days. Luckily I bought it at Sam's days before my trip and had no problem returning. I might buy one again before my next trip - kind of a disposable camera!I was looking at the Fuji just a few minutes ago and seems it gets low ratings and is not waterproof. People with those camera's are reporting that Fuji does not warranty cameras that go under water - hilarious!  Looks like we'll need to wait a couple of years and a few more versions until digital cameras of this type are functional.I'm going back to my 15 year old Canon Sureshot WP-1 35mm. It's the last film camera I own, but has made it through tons of beach, river rafting, camping, etc. trips without a hitch. You can pick one up on e-bay for $32!! Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kona Mom "Kona Mom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after three years of having a cheapy Kodak.  I LOVE the fact that it has the waterproof feature and is shockproof.  Having a waterproof camera when you live in Hawaii is a must.  I took it to the beach and pool the other weekend and got to take pictures of my daughter going down the waterslide.  Love the camera, love the price.

Reviews.Title: Great when it worked.
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Saulo
Reviews.Content: bought this camera to take along a hawaiian holiday.  the first few days with it, camera worked great.  Took it snorkeling, swimming in the pool.  Images and videos were nice and clear.  the 4th day of heavy usage, it wouldn't turn on and when I opened the battery door, water came out.  rest assured, I always checked to lock the door to prevent any accidental leakage but this thing was just dead.  So beware.  I guess next time, I will just with a go pro.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: bfg625
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  I tested it out and it works underwater.  I just got this but all of the modes and stuff make up for the picture quality. Although the picture quality is OK(around 10-ish megapixels if you ask me) it's enough for it's original purpose, to go underwater(take abuse, etc.) and still be able to take pictures.  I am bringing this awesome little camera to the cruise in which I am going on in a few weeks and I know all of my friends will be jealous.  The great part about this camera is that the charger works on USB so I can charge it with my phone, and my iPod Touch(I bought adapters for all of these).  The video is OK, and the pictures are pretty good.  The flash is nice and bright and all of the settings(ISO and exposure and more)certainly help.  Although it's not the best camera in the world and doesn't take the best pictures or videos in the world they are still good enough to crop and print out for a nice clear picture and this is SO WORTH it for the price considering some of the "better cameras" are over $250.  The buttons are OK because most of them click so you know you've pushed them and they are all pretty responsive.  I WAS a LITTLE worried about the zoom because those don't click but they are still very responsive.  NOTE: They work a little better on mine if you push a little toward the middle of the zoom panel.Also, the zoom is only 3.6X but that is enough for me because I will pretty much only be using this is for it's main purpose, the take pictures underwater.  The screen size is pretty good, considering it is such a minute camera.Overall, great camera for the price as I have said a few times already in this review.  Hope this helped future buyers out there.Thanks for your time,Jasmine

Reviews.Title: Camera is not tough or waterproof
Reviews.Author: Darren Knott
Reviews.Content: I just found out that Olympus is going to charge me the price of a new camera after their previous warranty repair didn't work.  I'm very upset that this camera has not only not lived up to expectations, but didn't even live up to my expectation for a non-tough, non-waterproof camera.  Here's the story.I'd had the camera for about a week when we decided to climb around on some waterfalls.  The camera worked great until I decided to swim across the pool at the bottom with the camera in my pocket.  When I got to the other side and tried to take a pic, I noticed the LCD had water in it.  I checked the lock on the side and made sure I had closed the lid tight.  The camera lid was locked and was sealed tight.However, when I opened it, water came trickling out.  On a whim, I tried blowing on the tripod mount hole.  Air went through it just like I was blowing on a straw.  I guess that's where my leak came from.I was pleasantly surprised when I sent it to Olympus and they said it was covered under warranty.  Despite a month long wait, I was very happy when my camera came back. It seemed to work fine, that is until a couple days later when I went to power up and hear a strange grinding noise.The camera had been in my bag or pocket, so it had been protected and I'm sure nothing happened to break it. Since I'd previously had such a good warranty experience, I sent it back to Olympus but was bitterly disappointed this time, to see that they are going to charge me the full price of the camera.  I've barely used this thing and it's already broken so bad that they want to totally refurbish it.I'd been very happy with Olympus up to this point, but if they don't make this right, I can warranty one thing...I'll never buy an Olympus product again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Hood
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a family vacation/cruise where I wanted to be able to take photos on the beach and while snorkeling.  It lasted 1 1/2 days.  I opened the camera to charge the battery and found moisture inside and the battery starting to corrode.  Fortunately, I was able to salvage my memory card.  I am soooo disappointed.  I had already read comments from other people who have had the same problem.  I should have listened.  If you have the money to spend, consider purchasing a camera with a better reputation.

Reviews.Title: Great in and out of water!
Reviews.Author: Ty's Mommy
Reviews.Content: Was really impressed that it took good, recognizable photos under water. Out of the water, it's pretty darn good too. If what you want outside is too bright or dark, tilt the camera up or down and when it exposes correctly, hold in your take button half way, tilt back down to your pic, and click it the rest of the way! My only complaint is that it needs a little more contrast and saturation. I just opened the pics with Windows Live Photo Gallery, and hit auto-fix, which fixed most of them great. If not, bump up the saturation or contrast. Easy fix!

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Tereesa Murphy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for a beach vacation in which most of our time was spent on the beach and in the water. This camera didn't even last 2 days. I first noticed water spots on the pictures so I decided not to use it and dry it out. Once the camera dried, I opened the battery compartment to find water inside and when I pulled out the battery, some corrosion had built up. We were at the mercy of the island we were on and paid triple the price for a new Olympus but tried a different model. That camera had failed on us the first day of use. I was  dissapointed not only for losing such great pictures but in the Olympus brand. I was not able to get a refund for the camera purchased on the island but was given store credit which was better than nothing at all. I hope to get refunded from the Amazon buyer I purchased it from. I would never recommend this camera nor any Olympus camera especially having two different models fail on us in the same week.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: thisguy

} } } Length:: 0:11 Minsthis is a video of me testing out the toughness of the camera and the waterproof and as you can see it holds up well and has pretty great quality

Reviews.Title: leaker
Reviews.Author: yagi
Reviews.Content: Within a month camera leaking water through the battery compartment after very limited use at the surface of the water (no diving). Gasket is clean. Buy another make and model.

Reviews.Title: The little camera that could
Reviews.Author: J. Burnside
Reviews.Content: This is the little camera that can take a beating and keep on ticking.  I bought this camera when I thought that it was completely waterproof (not to just 10') and took it on my honeymoon to Scuba Dive in the Dominican Republic.  While I didn't take the camera on deep dives, it survived snorkeling and bouncing off rocks just fine.  I have lots of great under water photos.  Plus we did an adventure trip of scaling up a series of 7 waterfalls.  This involved (wet) rock climbing and swimming.  The whole time I just had my camera's wrist strap attached to the buckle of my life vest.  Beautiful photos every time.Downsides:1) I do recommend buying a spare battery and charger for the camera.  Each battery seems to only last for about 5-6 hours of constant use.  Also leaving the battery in the camera over night seems to drain the battery a little.  Always start each day with a fresh fully charges battery.2) The camera is not that good long distance shots indoors.  Outside it is great and close up indoors it is good.3) It is also not the best at action shots.  Like most inexpensive digital cameras there is a delay between clicking the button and when the actual picture is taken.  Plus the photos tend to be blurry if there is too much movement.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Took it on holiday to Mexico over spring break. Great for snorkeling and playing around in the water. Does a fine job with HD movies, too. Works fine in and out of the water. The separate movie button was nice (instead of switching to movie mode and pressing the shutter release button like on other cameras, you just press a record button on the back of the camera).Only downside was the sort of short battery life. It didn't last a day of taking 50 or 100 pictures and a few short movies. I think I'll purchase a second battery, which will easily get me through a day.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money, but very limited battery life.
Reviews.Author: NA$HVILLE
Reviews.Content: Survived 3 snorkeling trips and took lots of other great pictures on our vacation last week. Pretty easy to use. The "?" feature made it easy to find the right mode to take pictures in different situations, and the results were mostly really good.The only problem was the battery life sucks! Ordered an extra battery when I bought the camera, but Amazon recommended the wrong one, so it didn't work. Also, Olympus uses an odd shaped cord, so I couldn't use any other USB cord to charge. Missed a lot of photo opportunities because of that. I plan to get an extra cord and another battery before I use the camera again for an extended period.

Reviews.Title: worked great underwater
Reviews.Author: S. Woodworth "Genie expert"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use while snorkeling in Hawaii.  I didn't have any problems with it, except the fish were too fast for me!  I got great shots of a sea turtle, however.  The color of the photos appears to be very saturated and water shots both above and below the surface turn out very blue.  I snorkeled for a couple of hours before the battery died, so it is better than a cheaper camera using AA batteries.  It also shoots in video, zoom mode, and wide angle "stitch together" mode.  I'm sure there are better models out there, but for the money this was a good deal instead of buying disposables.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Turbodad
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a waterproof camera for an up coming mud run.  Something I wouldn't care if it broke.  So I was looking for a cheap waterproof camera.  I looked at quite a few but the cheap ones were really cheap.  Either very few functions or didn't shoot video.  I stumbled upon this one and I am glad I did.  The mud run is still a month away but tested on the ski slopes and it did great.  I even took it to the pool and let my kids play with.  This camera is better than I thought it would be considering the price.  I feel comfortable recommending it.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I'm looking for a second camera to take traveling and not my professional camera.  This camera looked so promising, and it was $180 at Sam's Club.  After reading a review that gave this camera a 16/20, I decided to buy for a trip to Niagara Falls next week.  What bells and whistles!  It seemed perfect that this camera is rugged and waterproof.  It looked so good on paper.  I decided not to go with my gut (buy Canon or Sony says my gut).I took the camera back the next morning.  The battery can be put in backwards, which could damage the camera (according to the instructions).  Lame.  The pictures I took had a poor color quality with WAY too much noise for a 14.1MP photo (my old 7.2 Cybershot looks a billion times better). I switched from auto-mode to auto white balance mode and then to sunny setting WB, but it never improved the coolness of the pictures.  The red eye reducer worked well.  The video was not bad at all - 720p works for me.  The USB will charge the camera when plugged in and looked very convenient.  A little too feature rich for me - though it can be lots of fun to play around!I am so disappointed after being completely let down by this camera.  It really looked fantastic.  If the camera were about $100 cheaper, I probably would have kept it for the video or given it to my nephew.

Reviews.Title: O.K. camera
Reviews.Author: B. J. Sheats
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my grandson, who was going to Canada with a group for 10 days. He was 12. He promptly lost the charger so was unable to use it for most of the trip. The picture quality is good;however, am I the only one that expects an owner's manual in the box instead of a link to download and print it in tiny tiny fonts in the middle of a sheet of paper? Tons of paper, which he doesn't bother to read because it's too much work. The quick start guide didn't answer all the questions. Perhaps the younger generation knows instinctively how to use these cameras; however, I found it difficult. I'm a Baby Boomer, born in the 50s. Digital, schmigital.

Reviews.Title: No Good at all
Reviews.Author: pushpoppNH
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and used it for a day at the beach and it died within 20 minutes of being out of the box. All instructions were followed and we took it snorkeling but that night it refused to turn on and the screen would go blank. There was no water in the camera and I left on the charger on for 2 days but still nothing. I have seen on other reviews that seems has happened to other people! luckily Amazon took it back and I got a refund!On another note, the camera feels cheap. Not saying the camera needs to be heavy at all but The door which opens the battery compartment looks like it will break with one drop and the just the whole camera feels like it was not made to be bounced / slammed / swam around with! Even my friends used it and were amazed that it could be used underwater cause it felt cheap.The reason I bought this is I owned the same Olympus Tough but a 2010 model. It lasted for almost 2 years while I lived in Africa, in sand and heat and water and I didn't treat it well (bounced around in a backpack for all my trips in no case) but it always would get the shot. It did eventually die BUT it totally exceeded my expectations. Its a shame this one didn't last at all!On another note, even before the camera died, the first feature I tried using was the Panorama mode, but it would NEVER focus.Than the camera died and I just had it returned and didn't want a replacement.I am looking at getting the Panasonic LUMIX, about the same price range and hopefully will be better!

Reviews.Title: Not "tough" enough
Reviews.Author: mudderchick
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for Tough Mudder [...] event in May,hoping to get some good videos going through the obstacles. Spent several hours reading reviews on waterproof cameras and decided on this one based on most of the reviews were quite good, the price was fair, and I was going to be spending quite a bit of time in and out of mud and water.Practiced with it extensively on land, liked the pics and having one touch video was nice.HOWEVER, the "tough" should be taken out of the title of this camera.Let me preface this by saying I had it in my jogging pack (fanny pack style) not on my hip or front where it could get all banged up. After jumping into the first water obstacle (only 3 feet deep) it popped open and flooded the entire thing. I had specifically double-triple checked to make sure it was sealed appropriately and made the "click" they tell you about, I even put it in a bucket to make sure no bubbles, no issues. It did NOT get caught on anything, it did NOT even get banged on anything, it was the easiest of all the obstacles.Needless to say, this totally sucked. Luckily my non participating friends took plenty of pictures for me.... I also let the memory card dry out and though fuzzy, the pics I took pre drowning came out good enough.This camera might be fine for the beach but it sucks for anything more than that and I would worry even there that it would pop open and ruin your pics too. NOT TOUGH ENOUGH!

Reviews.Title: Returning
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1348
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on vacation to Jamaica two weeks ago. The picture quality is surprisingly nice, even underwater it's crystal clear. Besides that, it took about 30 seconds to get the camera to turn on each time I wanted to use it, which is a pain and causes a lot of missed picture opportunities, especially when snorkeling and fish are swimming by. You can't leave the camera on for a few minutes or take successive pictures or the battery will immediately drain. Even when fully charged, battery life is disappointing.I properly used the camera in shallow depths of water and cleaned/air dried it, but there would be condensation on the lens that shows up on pictures and really takes away from it.Just not what I would expect from an Olympus camera, so I'll probably buy a more expensive model.

Reviews.Title: Camera for the beach
Reviews.Author: M. Crebs "lotz"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take to the beaches around Oahu and to do some snorkeling with it. As soon as I got the camera I took some pictures around the house to get familiar with it and learn all the different modes and settings. I took it to the beach and walked straight into the ocean with it! I took several scenery pictures and even tried out the panoramic mode. The panoramic mode was alright but if you know how to use photoshop you would probably make a better picture that way. In the panoramic mode not all my pictures matched up even though I lined up the circles on the screen. I took a few underwater pictures but because the waves were rough that day all you could see was sand. After I got home I washed off the camera to make sure I got all the salt and sand off of it before opening the door to download my pictures. I looked at my pictures on my computer and zoomed in a bit and the pictures were clear and had no grain like a previous review on this product had stated. Over all I think this is a great camera especially if you are wanting to go on a vacation where you will see a lot of sea life or just want a tough camera to take a beating.

Reviews.Title: Another great Olympus product
Reviews.Author: Henry Wolford
Reviews.Content: I have become a die hard Olympus digital camera fan.  I've used them underwater, either with housings in the old days, or now two types of these "tough Series" of cameras.  This one was bought for the office to take pictures of events.  Employees are not the most careful with company property, so having a camera which is dustproof, waterproof, can be dropped to the floor without harm, and can be stepped on without harm; gives me a lot of peace of mind.  Can't do anything about it being "theftproof" but at these low prices I will just have to take that chance.

Reviews.Title: Great Value / Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: Phredd
Reviews.Content: I bought this after the new model was released, so I'm reviewing this as a $129 camera. At this price it is a great value for a waterproof camera. With good light, the pictures are really very good. With low light the pictures are still decent though noise is noticeable. It is easy to use, though with the small lens, even the tiniest drop of water will ruin the picture, so you must keep wiping the water. Most of these waterproof point-and-shoot cameras would probably share this problem. Yet it's a lot easier to wipe off the water than it is to keep a waterproof case on better camera from fogging. And at $129, it's about half the cost of a waterproof case on a really good camera.

Reviews.Title: Not bad.
Reviews.Author: J. Walton
Reviews.Content: Stand up to the reputation for ruggedness, and it is a satisfactory point and shoot pocket camera with one exception - the delay between button push and the picture being taken can sometimes be as great as a full second and a half.  This is a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: 310 Olympus Camera SNORKEL COMPANION
Reviews.Author: Deidre M. Quinn "dee"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband to use in Hawaii when we snorkeled (I have the 8010)  He loved that it is so light weight and easy to use under water. Its nice to have the record button on the front rather than going into the options and selecting to record. this way you can record a video, then when you stop it, go right back to snapping pictures again! We love this camera, it took great pictures....However..It was LOCKED and went black. we thought it was the battery (the battery does get sucked down pretty quickly. you can purchase additional batteries and chargers cheap though, we paid $20 for 2 additional batteries and a wall charger).  When we went to change the battery we saw that the camera had leaked water into the battery area and the screen in the front fogged up inside. TOTAL BUMMER since our trip wasnt over yet. And of course, our 30 day warranty was up 2 days before this happened (the store is still giving us exchange credit though phew). I have not seen reviews saying anyone else has had this problem, so we are using our store credit to re-purchase this camera and hope to have better luck this time!

Reviews.Title: hot rod point and shoot
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: great little camera. perfect for fishing, hunting and tough enough to bounce around in the truck or boat. takes great pictures without a bunch of BS.

Reviews.Title: RED HOT TOUGH CAMERA
Reviews.Author: DREAM.Z
Reviews.Content: Took camera on trip to Vail. Double Diamond runs; snow and ice. Cold weather and wind NO Problem.takes nice pics easily. Purchased 8gb memory card and shooting at highest setting. Once uploaded to computerAwesome Pics. Not an SLR or best of best but good camera to take with you anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Great for the cold
Reviews.Author: Anthony L Lee
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to an ice festival in North Pole Ak and was able to take photos during the entire outing.  I didn't have any problem with the battery dying or the cold getting to the camera at -12 degrees.  My young daughter dropped it in the snow and it continued to take great pictures.  Last year my expensive Nikon didn't make it only 30 minutes before freezing up.  I look forward to using it on our trip to Hawaii.  I suggest this camera to anyone going to the snow.

Reviews.Title: Would Recommend
Reviews.Author: cracieladi
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on a cruise ship, and it broke after one day, the view screen was broken, so took it back and exchanged it for a new one.  The new one works great...still have a little hesitation with the "shock resistance" (considering we didn't drop the camera the first day).  Had the chance to use it underwater in the pool and the ocean...takes great pics, very vivid and beautiful! The panoramic setting is less than ideal, it takes 3 separate pictures and then "weaves" them together, but if it is a scenery shot (like over the ocean) it is hard to line up the shot.  Wish that was a little different but when you can line it up correctly the panoramic turns out GREAT!!! :)I would recommend this camera! (just make sure where you buy it has a return/exchange policy or get the warranty for extra protection)

Reviews.Title: We had lots of fun!
Reviews.Author: J. Otto
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera mainly to take snorkeling photos on our vacation to Dominican Republic.  We used it for that and so much more!  We had fun playing with the different settings, picture modes, and especially the panoramic setting.  Unfortunately the camera was lost in a taxi.  We have a few other cameras, including a dSLR but I have missed having this little camera around.  So, today I bought it again, and I am sure we will get as much enjoyment from this one as we did before.When using it underwater, remember to soak it in fresh water after for about 10 minutes so it isn't harmed by the salt or chlorine.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Marlene Blanchard
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these 4 months ago for my grandaughter who is 16, and she hasn't been able to hurt it yet! This one is for my daughter-in-law, as she kills cameras all the time. And I plan on buying one for myself. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Good for "tough" situations but not the best all-around
Reviews.Author: Adam F
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift after we went rafting in the Grand Canyon and a fellow rafter had the same camera.  We backpack and kayak frequently and this is a great camera to take along, being resistant to most dirt and water.  The downside of the camera is the quality of photos.  Unless it is a clear blue day with optimal lighting, the pictures are grainy.  Any movement and the photo is blurred.  While I love it's durability (I do not want to take my SLR on a kayak!)it is not my "all around, go to" camera. We save this one for only extreme situations but for the price, it does quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: I am really pleased with this camera. I have bought all different types of cameras and this one is a great camera for the price. My daughter is a photographer and she has an older model of this camera and loves it. She uses it just as a point and shoot since she doesn't want to lug her SLR camera everywhere. We liked the waterproof, shatterproof and freezeproof qualities. She normally only has a camera last for a year or so due to dropping it or getting it wet and this one has lasted over 2 years. So happy I took her advice and found this at such a great price.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: teach "ms peggy"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera before going on vacation.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the pictures.  They came out very grainy and unclear.  A manual did not even come with the camera, everything was downloadable.  What happened to a nice little manual that you can sit and read with the product in hand?

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: Tae
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  Going on a cruise and needed something durable and waterproof, yet small.  It has many shooting modes to play around with and I think it's easy to navigate around the menu/settings.  I was skeptical about this purchase because I read some reviews about the battery door opening accidentally while using and the camera getting ruined when using it underwater.  Those were the first things that I tested before the cruise to make sure there weren't any defects.The battery door has a recessed switch in order to open it.  You can also lock the door by moving the same switch into a cut out that is 90 degrees to the main travel path so in order to open it accidentally you have to unlock it first.  I don't see how I will be able to do that the way I hold my camera.I submerged the camera underwater while taking HD 720p video and the waterproof feature works great.  Make sure to read all the directions.  You need to rinse any sand and salt water off the camera before opening it.  The sand and salt could be trapped underneath the battery door gasket and prevent you from getting a water tight seal.  Maybe that's why some people were having issues.My only complaint is that it did not come with any external SD memory card.  I did however have a spare one so I wasn't without.If you're looking for a small durable camera that takes good pictures this is for you.  If you're looking to take high quality photos get a DSLR.  No point and shoot camera will give you that quality until they make those lenses small enough to fit in a compact design.

Reviews.Title: NOT for watersports
Reviews.Author: Mykel "Mykel"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the "water proof" and "shock proof" claim.  Shock proof I did not verify as we only had it for less than a week.  The water proof claim was found to be false.  Actually, I think that it is water proof but the battery/SD card pocket cover latch is so poorly engineered and constructed that I bumped it open just putting my hand thru the hand strap.I didn't get a chance to mention it to my wife before she took it to the pool with the kid.We have returned the camera to Sam's and are looking for another camera that is truly water proof.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Painful lesson learned...
Reviews.Author: Renge'
Reviews.Content: Never buy a new camera and take it on the trip of a lifetime without trying it out first! Ended up just hating this camera as I struggled to take action pics from our double-decker bus tour in Barcelona. The balky thing came super close to being slammed off the top of the bus as I missed shot after shot struggling w/ the non-responsive zoom buttons. We bought a "tough" camera since we figured we might drop it accidentally at some point and didn't want that to be all she wrote. But I felt that a massive amount of responsiveness was lost in the "shockproof" rubberized backing covering the buttons. I have to say that I would never use it again if I had the choice. My husband didn't mind it but he's not that into photo taking. I was very disappointed and I'm not a very tech-y kind of person.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: HoustonHusker
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about buying this camera based on the low price, however, it had good reviews, so I thought I would give it a try.  I mainly wanted it for it's waterproof abilities as I wanted to take pictures and videos in the pool/beach of my kids.  Once I received it, it took very little to get all set up to my perferences.  I'm by no means "techy" and it was quite simple.  Then I tried it out in the pool taking pictures and videos of the kiddos playing around and it worked perfectly.  The video and pictures came out terrific.  So I wanted to give it a try on just normal pictures too and I must say, it takes pretty darn good normal pictures too.  The only thing that I would knock it for is that underwater the LCD screen is sometimes hard to see if it's bright out.  Overall, I would definitely purchase this camera again.  I hope it lives up to it's "Tough" namesake and lasts awhile!

Reviews.Title: Good Underwater Camera - Leaked but repaired with warranty
Reviews.Author: Here-o
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after thoroughly researching underwater cameras for a trip to the Galapagos where I would spend 8 days on a boat and really no access to civilization. I needed something that would be durable, something that could be dropped in case I was clumsy, something that could take pictures underwater as well as out of the water in case I saw something on the water's surface, easy to use-- I wasn't going to fiddle with settings, could take video in case sea lions wanted to play with me in the water, could go underwater at least 10 feet (even though I only float on the water's surface, I know that I'll be sticking my arm out with the camera so you have to account for some of that), and couldn't have external moving parts becuase I didn't want sand to get caught in the parts or chances for the moving parts to get bumped and broken. You could easily spend $300-$400 for an underwater camera with these features. I ultimately decided that I wouldn't spend more than $175 because I had to budget for the trip. I was taking my big digital SLR camera so I could take high quality out-of-water pictures so I didn't need the best overall camera. BTW, I purchased the orange color because I wanted something bright that would stick out in almost any condition in case I dropped it or needed to find it.After deciding on this camera, I called Olypus to find out what the most common user errors were that caused the camera to malfunction. The rep said it was usually hair or dust that would get caught between the water seals and the camera.I tested the camera in the pool and handed the camera to my 4 year old to take pictures. I wanted to make sure it didn't leak and could take any bumps my child would expose to the camera. My son didn't ever drop the camera or bump it, but the camera was easy enough for him to push the shutter button and the screen large enough for him to see what pictures he was taking. After testing in the pool, I felt I could take the camera on my trip.I was able to use the camera on 3 snorkeling trips. I used it on land on the beach for a few shots of a ghost crab and some sea lions. I used the camera's auto setting and the picture seemed a bit bright. For the underwater shots, I used the camera's underwater mode. The pictures were slighly dark, so days that didn't have bright sunlight in the water looked ok, but if there's heavy clouds, you may not be able to see anything in your pictures unless the objects are very close. You may be better off using the auto setting and then color correcting the pictures on your computer for underwater pictures-- but I haven't had a chance to test this out.I recharged the battery to the fullest after every trip. Before closing up the camera's side, I made sure that there wasn't anything (hair, sand, dust) on the seals and in the way of the seals. I always made sure the side's button was in the locked position before I got anywhere near water. After snorkeling trips, I rinsed the camera per the instructions and always let it air dry with the side open. I didn't want anything to happen to this camera during this once in a lifetime trip.On my 4th snorkeling trip, I took a few pictures then my camera turned off. I wasn't able to get the camera to come back on during that trip. When I got back on the boat, I tried recharging the battery because there was no other indication that something else was wrong after taking out the battery and visual camera inspection. When I went back to check on my camera after a couple of hours, I noticed condensation inside the screen. I tried turning on the camera and it still didn't work.I had read other people were able to air out their cameras and it worked later. I left the camera's side door open for a full day to dry and took out the battery. I did not try to charge it during this time because another tourist said that electrical currents could make it worse, especially since it leaked with salt water. One day of air drying and still no luck. I tried every day there after to air dry and turn it on, but it didn't work for the rest of my trip. Which is too bad because I missed out on sharks, manta rays, and penguins.When I arrived home, I turned on the camera and it actually came on for one second then turned itself off. I wasn't able to get the camera to stay on. I tried submitted an online warrant request, but the website didn't work correctly. I called Olympus customer service and she said sometimes the website's online form didn't work correctly. The rep was very nice and polite. I explained what happened and she directed me to a link to print out a form. She gave me a case number and told me to put it on the form when I filled it out. I mailed the camera with the form, a copy of the warranty that came in the original Olympus box, battery, and cables. I received the camera in less than 2 weeks! Wow! They mailed it back via UPS and the box was smashed, opened, taped, and had holes in the box. I was very concerned that the camera was damaged from UPS. I was able to turn on the camera, but haven't had a chance to really test it since I just received the camera yesterday. The paperwork included with my camera said they replaced the circuit board and screen. I am thoroughly impressed with the customer service. I had an excellent experience with Olympus and feel bad for the others that had poor experience.I would give Olympus a 5 star for customer service and a 4.0 star for the actual functionality and utility of the camera. I notched down the 1 star because the camera's pre-set settings for underwater and sunny day seems to be slightly off on exposure, and the camera leaked during the trip. If I had purchased one of those $300 cameras, the exposure issue would have knocked off more than a star, but given the cost of this Olympus, I'm not going to be that picky. Overall, the camera does it's job. Yes, there was the leakage issue and I wished that it didn't happen (I'm still bummed about the missed pictures), but I was able to get some pictures at the beginning of my trip and there was virtually no hassle with getting it repaired.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: BigAzzKiwi
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I needed a new one because my old digital camera was about 7 years old and this works so much faster and easier. I also love the color! I've noticed though that pictures on the screen do look a little grainy but when they're uploaded onto the computer everything looks perfect. I think that has something to do with the screen being water proof. Speaking of waterproof, I still haven't tested my camera under water because I don't get many chances to do that up here. But I wanted a tough camera that could stand to be thrown around and that's exactly what I got. It's been dropped a couple times already and there's no scratches, which is  great because I definitely don't want it to look like my old camera did! :)

Reviews.Title: Good deal!
Reviews.Author: T. Harris
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for use outdoors and under rugged conditions.  The camera is light weight and takes excellent sharp photos outdoors.  The zoom feature leaves a little to be desired.  I am having a little bit of a problem taking photos at night where there is a light in the background.  The indoor pictures have bit of noise.  But overall for the price the camera is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures, but could be better quality
Reviews.Author: sk
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures, especially for the price, but the images could be better quality.  Using the camera underwater sometimes produces slightly foggy looking pictures, but I have noticed this with most waterproof cameras.  Overall, I'd recommend this camera based on the price and the quality, given its low price compared to other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: cjb2780
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a GREAT camera. I bought one about 6 years ago & it finally crapped out...not because of poor quality, which is why I purchased another. I use it scuba diving all the time & am very pleased with it!

Reviews.Title: It's been around the world
Reviews.Author: H. Hilgeford
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take with my on a cruise.  It did perfectly through pools and ocean.  Not only did it last for the cruise, but years later it remains water tight, and it's been on several houseboat trips, including being thrown off the side of the boat.  BUT! It doesn't float, and I would highly recommend buying a float attachment for it.  I bought a yellow Chums waterproof camera float and it works perfectly!  It's important to read the directions and let it air out after each time you open the battery compartment.  The poor ratings on here clearly didn't read the directions and take proper care of their camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Todd White
Reviews.Content: Bought this when I went to Mexico, went snorkeling and para sailing with it and it took great pictures and videos above and below sea.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for over a year.  Good photos, can't say much about underwater, but nice to know it can get splashed.

Reviews.Title: Solid Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: Pros: compact, solid metal body design.  Fits easily in the pocket and feels solid in the hand.  Takes moderate abuse well.  Works well in wet environments.  Simple to use point and shoot automatic functions, with enough manual settings to satisfy most users.  Modest, but acceptable zoom for most situations.  A good bargain when on sale.  Fixed lens doesn't drain the batteries like cameras that retract and extend with every start up.  LCD screen is bright and the menu functions are not overly complicated.  Basic camera functions are fairly intuitive.  The macro function is very good and the camera can take good photos at extremely close range (less than an inch) in super macro mode.Cons: not the best picture quality in it's class, struggles a bit in challenging light conditions.  Not the best performer in it's class or price range, but is capable of taking good photos in good light.  Shutter button is small and hard to use for those with large fingers.  Battery/SD card door is a bit flimsy and is the weak part of the overall design - use care here.  Auto focus can be a bit slow and will occasionally lock on the wrong target.  The flash is limited and generally ineffective, but this is not uncommon in this price range.  A steady hand is needed in low light conditions.  Not the fastest start up time (~ 4 seconds) but acceptable.  Battery capacity is limited but typical: around 150-175 shots per charge, depending upon usage.  Users should consider carrying a spare battery.Conclusion: I use mine for fishing, when a quick point and shoot, durability and waterproofing override picture quality limitations.  Not the best cameras for taking high quality portraits, but its rugged build, overall dependable performance and compact simple design make up for it's shortcomings.  A good deal if you can get one on sale.  A great backup camera to keep in the car, or for use by the kids.  If you are looking for a pure waterproof camera for underwater use, I would look else where.  But if you need a durable point and shoot that can tolerate a little moisture and abuse, you can't go to wrong with the TG-310.

Reviews.Title: Lasted one trip
Reviews.Author: Heidi Barbrick
Reviews.Content: Got this camera two years ago for a trip to Cuba. Took good pics (a little white noise, but you can't have everything) and great underwater vid. We were really impressed with it for the price. Always checked the battery housing before snorkeling. Last year for our trip I got 2 pics and 1/2 minute of video before it died. Once back on the boat I opened it to find the battery housing had leaked. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: good camera but didn't last long
Reviews.Author: TooFaSS4u
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera for a trip to mexico. it took amazing pictures, even underwater. it was not until after i got back home that when i used it again, i noticed a fog on the lens. i never had it in water after my trip. all of my trip pictures turned out fantastic though. i would still buy another one of these cameras. maybe it was just a lemon.

Reviews.Title: this company sux
Reviews.Author: jessica friedman
Reviews.Content: i got the camera and it didnt work, i spent as much money to try and fix it as it cost. not worth it.

Reviews.Title: One star is to high for this product.
Reviews.Author: marc
Reviews.Content: We have owned this camera for a little more than 3 months. A few weeks ago while charging the battery overnight the battery somehow exploded in the camera. Hence the camera no longer worked. ( We have been over meticulous with this product and following the directions) We thought replacing the battery was all we needed to do, however, it was impossible to find a battery at any store  to replace. I ended up having to buy one on Amazon and spending $20.00 to ship it to me to make sure we had it in time for our vacation. Long story short the camera still does not work  and I am not sure if Amazon or Olympus will back this product I will keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: took it for somones gift and had to return this back.
Reviews.Author: V. Alapati "venkata"
Reviews.Content: got it as a gift item for a friend. the item came packed with a bit of damage to the box. amazon customer service did a great job by taking it back. this review is not for the item as i haven't used it at all but for the way its packaged. even the way it was packaged didn't give me a good impression of the product. th color differs a bit on what is seen in the picture. a five for amazon service and a 2 for the product.

Reviews.Title: not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: Hehr "hehren"
Reviews.Content: this was my second waterproof camera.  The first one failed.  Then I read reviews about the importance of cleaning properly after use in saltwater, because the salt causes the seals to fail.I cleaned this one regularly, and it still failed after snorkeling.  Was able to retrieve some of the pics on the memory card, but the camera is a loss.I am going to stick to regular non-waterproof camera.I think inexpensive waterproof camera is an oxymoron, unless you just get one of the throwaway cameras.

Reviews.Title: olympus
Reviews.Author: bcoll
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera,because of its lower price, and I didn't know a thing about digital cameras. This camera is very good for the lower price,and its not hard to figure out how to use,for a first time digital camera owner,thats not too interested in figuring out how to use something. The battery life Is excellent, and its lightweight. I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: John Stowell "John Winston Stowell"
Reviews.Content: All the features that I want for a water-resistant pocket camera.Comprehensive menu that even I can understand and implement.Good value for the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Olympus WaterProof Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot so far. It is waterproof and I have used it for my trip last month oversea. It work well under the water despite the quality of picture is not great. It is still bit blurry as I took the shots under the water. In term of its feature, you will like it with several setting shots that you can take. I would recommend to the buyers to test it out. The pricing is affordable and in term of design it look good. I selection of this camera was with the help from Amazon staff (supervisor) who was diligently and nicely helped me made the purchase. I would buy product that sold by Amazon again in the future. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: Olympus Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: ejk
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a graduation gift for a grandson.  His pictures and video were beautiful.  He has taken it on hikes and other activities and he is very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: Katelyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last June (2012) and it lasted very well up until we went to Jamaica in June (2013). The camera was working great and maintaining its waterproof ability in the pool and on the beach. Until about our third day we went snorkeling and the camera said the SD card was full. We are not good snorkelers so we werent diving deep at all. So we returned to our room and opened the camera to change out the SD card only to discover there was water in the battery compartment. Immediately took everything out and started drying the camera with hair dryer qtips etc. We then let it sit open for a day and tried the camera, no power, and the battery would not charge. Long story short it seems that the camera is still capable of reading and SD card, but not charging a battery or powering on by itself. I just ordered a new battery to try that, so we will see how that works out and I will update the review on whether or not the camera is shot. Overall all i really enjoyed the camera until it unexpectadly leaked in water.Edit: 8/2613 olympus agreed to fix the camera for free since it was so close to warranty period. Just got it back today, and appears to be in good working order. My old battery is shit from the water so I ordered new and all should be well!

Reviews.Title: I use this for work
Reviews.Author: mitchell
Reviews.Content: I have it attached to a monopod that extends to about 20 ft and it gets banged around a lot.  It still takes quality pictures and gets the job done.  Haven't tested the water proof part yet.

Reviews.Title: really good camera and on time
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: very good camera for the price, but it did not come with a memory card.  Otherwise, price is good for what I got.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Carlos Eduardo Alvares Correa
Reviews.Content: Camera back home very practical easy to carry yet downloaded the pictures I took, and I was afraid to stay with her at Aquatica in the U.S., but I'll do a test on the beach in Brazil

Reviews.Title: NOT WORTH IT
Reviews.Author: jackie
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera to take it on vacation. I received it  during the week, let the camera charge and thought i would take it out fishing to try it out before my vacation. Took a few pictures with it. Went swimming I tried to take a few pictures underwater not even a few inches under and well it completely stop working. Not worth it. I am returning it

Reviews.Title: Tough to manipulate tiny hard to see controls
Reviews.Author: CharlesT
Reviews.Content: I've used the TG310 for two years now. Primary need is a camera that I can carry while I'm fishing in the surf.... and which i can operate one handed and/or in the dark. When i have a fish on the line or am holding one in my hand it is imperative that I be able to switch it on and shoot with my free hand. Sometimes I need to check and change the setting... more so because i have inadvertently pushed the wrong part of the button array and have it in some unusable mode.... or in video or playback. I generally cannot see any markings and  simply cannot operate the teeny tiny TG310 buttons by feel. Almost threw the damn thing into the ocean on Sunday night. Was trying to catch my two sons holding a 40 inch striper that one of the caught in the surf at night. Big moment. Big disappointment I could not get an exposure.  Ended up running back to the truck and got the shot with my D300s. Slimey fishy hands ... but I can operate that camera one handed by feel and get its menus to light up if I need them. Not a fair comparison by any means. If there had been any rocks on the beach the Tough would have been tested. Too Tough to use in the dark and operate one handed. Hoping to find another camera with better layout of controls. Bigger would be better.

Reviews.Title: Works well but....
Reviews.Author: StepByStep Home Services - Michigan Home Insp...
Reviews.Content: I've owned several Olympus cameras but I have to say this was not the best one. For the money it's worth it but don't expect to get the bells and whistles you will from better models. The controls are tedious to use when trying to take pictures with gloves on, unlike some other models, and it lacks lighting when in macro mode.I used the camera for less than a week and went back to an older model. This camera is now a backup in case my older one breaks. In the end I wish I would have spend more but you do get what you for in this camera.

Reviews.Title: the camera us great
Reviews.Author: Alexandra
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera ever picture quality is great I only wish it had a better zoom. otherwise it is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: batman
Reviews.Content: everything worked well happy so far have not taken it under water yet lets hope that is good that's why we purchased thanks again!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera got it on time
Reviews.Author: colleen
Reviews.Content: Execellent value, camera was in perfect order. I would have liked to receive the instructions and all of the attachements that came with it.

Reviews.Title: Jobsite camera
Reviews.Author: MtPeaks
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that will hold up to tough jobs then try this one out.  This camera was purchased to take photos of in progress construction jobs and it has been used in all types of weather.  After a year It is still working without issues and you get good quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It works perfect for my needs and pictures turn out great. I also love that it is tough cus i drop it all the time and doesn't even get a scratch!

Reviews.Title: good for underwater pictures and videos...
Reviews.Author: Katrina
Reviews.Content: However, as for regular pictures, I found that the quality wasn't too great. I bought it strictly for underwater and waterproof adventures, but I will stick to my other camera for the rest of my photos.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: brewhaha
Reviews.Content: I took this on a cruise to the Caribbean and although it took lots of nice pictures, unfortunately when I got home it wouldn't turn on anymore. I followed directions thoroughly and am disappointing that the negative reviews were true. Hopefully I can return.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Frances Boman
Reviews.Content: The recipient loves it.  Works great.  The camera takes great pictures and videos.  Small size makes it very handy to use.

Reviews.Title: Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: C. Jett "Wormologist extraordinaire, yup..."
Reviews.Content: Got it for my best friend, she seems to like it (except its blue).  we'll see how it holds up to water in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: dek
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great product, we already had purchase an older version of the camera and i wanted a version for myself. I have been very pleased with it, and will continue to use this camera for many years. I like the waterproof feature, as it allows me to take underwater videos and to go kayaking with no worries about the camera. Good buy, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great accessory for the beach!
Reviews.Author: JoBuck
Reviews.Content: This little camera really is waterproof for just the swimming pool or shallow water at the beach. We didn't try very deep, but it was so fun to take pictures under water and even for pictures above the water, we didn't have any worries about catching great shots of the kids playing in the ocean. A great camera to have for family trips!

Reviews.Title: disappointed in picture quality
Reviews.Author: Joshua J. Coon
Reviews.Content: we bought this to replace an earlier model of this camera that got lost. this one, while 'tough' has poor picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Jenn B "jennitaloca"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for husband. He wanted something that could withstand sitting in a backpack and rough trail rides. He wanted a phone he didn't have to baby. Takes good pics. Happy with purchase

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera for price and features
Reviews.Author: Heath
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pretty good pictures for its price and waterproof/shockproof ability.  I would like to have a viewfinder and not just a screen but then I knew that ahead of time.  The only thing I really don't like about it is that it, as far as I can figure out, it either shuts of quickly when idle or can be set to stay on for quite a long time draining the battery.  it needs a middle ground.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: candyaple
Reviews.Content: Christmas present for my daughter-in-lawShe wanted an underwater camera for their vacations for pictures of her childrenShe loved it

Reviews.Title: It's alright...older models are better
Reviews.Author: Ana Maria Katrina Diaz
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this camera to be like my old Olympus. Buttons on this one are rubber which at times make it difficult to press. It's also a bit slow. I guess you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: Nice waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew Cohn
Reviews.Content: I like having a well made, waterproof camera. We take it to the beach and lots of other places. Also, was great to sent to camp with our daughter (it is tough).The photos are good, but not great - but we have other cameras for when we don't need something "tough" or waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: ckeller
Reviews.Content: I am a very basic point-and-shoot user but I love that it's durable and waterproof, and I bought an Olympus floatie strap to put on when I use it in/around water. I am very happy with the camera that I bought around 9 months ago (and I am TOUGH on cameras). Takes great pictures. The menu is a little bit slow, but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: good pic but really bat batery life and startup time...
Reviews.Author: Esteban Esquivel Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for around a year or more... and is nice, but the battery life is really really bad, last time I used it,was in one trip to the amusement park and it didnt survive half day... It's a real shame, and also after I press the power button it takes around 5 to 7 sec to be ready and that's to much... in summary, really good pic quality, good video quality, but you'll have to keep on charging it every 4 hours of use and have it ready arround 10 sec before u plan to take the shot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Even After I Got Water Inside by Accident!
Reviews.Author: Dina Becker
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my 8 year old son to take pictures and video with at waterparks and when kayaking.  After our last trip to the beach, I went to rinse it off in the sink under running water and forgot to close the battery door!  I realized it instantly and pulled it out of the water.  It was too late, however.  When I tried using the camera I could hear the motor turn on but the screen wouldn't come on.  It WAS taking pictures, though, because the flash would go off and when I put the memory card into another camera, I could see the picture I just took.  I called Olympus Tech support and they told me that if the camera had a chance to dry out, it may work.  I decided to give it try before sending it to them for an $80.00 fix.  When I plugged the camera into the wall to charge the battery, condensation would appear on the screen.  I realized that was helping to draw the water out.  Since I have 3 batteries, I charged all three and continued to let the camera air dry in a dry place.  After 5 days, the camera WORKED PERFECTLY once again!!  It's like it never even happened!  This really lives up to its "TOUGH" name!The reason I give it 4 stars is because the pictures are ok.  They're not the greatest, but for the money, this camera serves the purpose that we bought it for--allowing my son to take it with us on water outings.  I also have a Canon Powershot D10 which is waterproof, but was $300.00.  The pictures are much better, but for a greater price.  It is true that the battery doesn't last long, but they're cheap enough that I bought two extras and always have them ready.  The only feature my son doesn't care for is that when you're taking video, you can't zoom in or get farther away.  You have to do that before starting your video.Finally, the features of the camera are awesome.  After some practice, you can take beautiful panoramic pictures.  You can also take pictures that look like drawings, or distort the picture like you're in a fishbowl, just to name a few.  The underwater mode takes some pretty neat snorkeling pictures.I recommend this camera as an alternative to buying a disposable waterproof camera to use on water outings.  Glad mine still works after my stupidity!!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: buenavista
Reviews.Content: this is a very good camera and has a very good price, but only use one time and no more work

Reviews.Title: NOT  waterproof, EVEN if cared for, picture quality slightly off
Reviews.Author: nopotato
Reviews.Content: to start with weatherproof quality, which is the raison d'etre of the camera. I have now used it in the summer in many american lakes, where it worked, but also in sea water where it failed.  I had always washed the camera immediately after in regular tap water.Now to the picture quality. One expects some impairment relative to normal cameras, and the picture does seem slightly soft. Moreover, the flash is far too bright, and one must snap from much farther away with a zoom to ensure any type of moderate exposure. Really this should not be the case.

Reviews.Title: Hit or Miss
Reviews.Author: Mfpipkin
Reviews.Content: I got this camera months before our honeymoon to ensure that it would withstand the water and we would be able to get some great snorkeling pictures.I had taken it out to the lake and ocean twice before the honeymoon and it worked fine, pictures weren't real clear but that was because of the visibility of the water.First day we were in Maui, the water was great and clear and we took the camera snorkeling. I was able to get about 10 good pictures then I turned it off because the battery was dying (my fault, I had forgotten to charge it since our last trip 2 weeks prior). When we got back to the hotel room I took the battery out to charge it and it was FRIED! Battery acid was everywhere and the camera smelled like it was about to catch on fire. I tried my best to dry it out and left sitting for a while, then I put in my back up battery and the camera would not register it and it started sizzling that battery as well.Obviously water had gotten in it and it does not work anymore. We had to use a disposable water camera for the rest of the trip.Very disappointing and I'm not sure what the cause of it was. I made sure the battery and SD card compartment was locked properly and I didn't go deeper than 10 feet when snorkeling.Maybe I just got a dud?

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: LS
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for almost a year and I like it a lot. The resolution is great, more than you will need and the fact that it is very durable is a huge bonus! I have not used it underwater and not sure I ever will. I was debating about getting the model that it a little more expensive and is crushproof but this one has suited me just fine. The only cons I would say is that it doesn't take good pictures in low light without the flash (they will be blurry) and the pictures look very blue on the LCD screen. But they look normal when you upload them and print them, so it is a minor issue to me. All in all, a good camera for the money with nice features!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Underwater surprise
Reviews.Author: Corey_A&F;
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera refurbished for our vacation in key west.  It far exceeded our expectations!  The intended purpose was for snorkeling and capturing pictures of fish and coral.  It took very clear pictures, much clearer then the disposable film cameras.  The biggest surprise was taking pictures in the swimming pool.  It was a lot of fun with our group of our friends to make funny pictures and bubbles.The 14mp allowed for great shots.  The biggest lack is the short zoom lens, but since water is not as clear as air it does not make much of a difference.  We had no issues with any water leaks damaging the camera, battery or memory card.  We were able to take about 200 pictures a charge.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a tubing trip on the Niobrara River in north west Nebraska. several other DRUNK! people including myself put this camera to the test. i would gladly buy another.

Reviews.Title: Good for the first year
Reviews.Author: mercuryval
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to the Caribbean to take underwater pictures. It worked well for the first year. We got amazing shots, and we cleaned the camera as the instructions specified. If you compare the number of shots we took to the low quality and high cost of development of an underwater film camera, the camera is worth it just for that year alone. That said, I expect a quality product, and I was disappointed after that first year.We went back to the Caribbean the following year. The camera worked well for the first few days. Then, while snorkeling on a reef, the camera stopped working. It was giving me a warning indicator (that meant there was an open compartment or a foreign object preventing the camera from being watertight, therefore the camera would not work until we got it serviced). There was no open compartment, and nothing was in the way. It was just a malfunction of the sensor, but it would not allow the camera to operate, even on dry land.Obviously, we couldn't fix it while on vacation. We had to go home, and luckily we had purchased an extended warranty. Still, we had to pay for shipping, and if I add up the cost of shipping and an extended warranty, it probably would have been a better deal to buy a new underwater camera. I have never been an Olympus fan... all my other cameras, including my digital SLR, are Cannons.I am going back to the Caribbean this year, after a year of not using the camera, and I'm nervous to trust it. I haven't decided yet whether I will risk using my Olympus, or whether I will try a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera!
Reviews.Author: SWH
Reviews.Content: This is a good little waterproof camera!  I bought this for an anniversary gift for my husband and we used it in Maui.  It worked great in the pool, ocean, and as a regular camera.  The colors are washed out though, had to use some simple editing software to bring the contrast and colors back.  The battery life was ok... about 150 pictures and 15 minutes of video.  For the cost of the camera, it did what I expected.  Good little point and shoot, fun to have one that can get wet.  I would recommend a float bracelet if you are taking it into the ocean or pool, it keeps the camera visible and above the 10 feet recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Battery sucker
Reviews.Author: beltlib
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a Christmas gift.  Took it on a cruise in May.  After less than an hour in the water, it doesn't work.  Some how water leaked in, the battery got crusty and now the camera won't work at all.  Tried different battery, connected to computer etc.  Nothing.The battery life SUCKED!  Seriously, after one day of pictures you had to recharge.  I wonder if had something to do with settings, but I could never figure it out.  It took great pictures while it worked, but I would not buy this as a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, especially for the price
Reviews.Author: cassiesmith00
Reviews.Content: So far I have only used this camera once but it was on a float trip.  The camera worked well under water and took decent shots. The outside photos turned out great.  I have not yet tried to use it inside.  The video feature works well also.  I love the multi-shot feature where you hold the button down and it takes continuous pictures.  I got some great shots of my fiance jumping off cliffs - action shots of him all the way down.  I would definitely reccommend this camera for someone looking for a decent, inexpensive, waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't hold up.
Reviews.Author: T. LaRiccia
