Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas.  By the second week in June, it had quit functioning. I didn't even use the underwater features and in fact took most of my pictures inside.  The images the camera takes are okay, but this is the second Olympus camera I've had break on me in a year. My first one was *just* over a year old and was therefore *just* out of warranty. This time, the camera is still under warranty, so I just sent it in for repair (on my dime- 30 bucks to ship it back to them!) and now I get to cross my fingers and wait, hoping they'll fix it and maybe even get it back to me before summer's over.  I've had Olympus cameras almost my entire adult life, but if I end up having to buy yet another camera, it'll be a different brand.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: csonnier
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our trip to cozumel.  Loved being able to take it in the water with us and on our snorkeling trips.  No problems with leaking.  Only thing I figured out is the shutter speed is a little slower when under the water so I learned to keep my hands steady a little longer than normal.  We got some great shots of  beautiful fish along with beautiful beach shots of us.  Won't go on another beach trip without it!!

Reviews.Title: Not as tough as advertised
Reviews.Author: Spexxy
Reviews.Content: The waterproof feature is fun to use, but I didn't find this product to be nearly as tough as the ads suggested.  After having it for not even three months, it dropped and the latch that holds the battery in place snapped off.  It's still under warranty, but I have to ship it over to the States to get it fixed, which ends up costing me money.  Not what I was hoping for from a "tough" camera!

Reviews.Title: Broke in one week
Reviews.Author: Uncle Vargas
Reviews.Content: It's hard to operate the zoom and the trigger, after one week I got water inside the camera and knew about that because a malfunction in the memory card, It's stopped working.

Reviews.Title: It survived my Jamaica trip
Reviews.Author: mw6sense
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a Jamaica trip.  I took the camera for the first time to snorkeling, zip-lining, beach and pool.  It took decent outdoor and underwater pictures and video.  It did not experience any leakage.  I followed the included olympus instructions on cleaning the camera after each underwater use and it has not been failing.  It is truth that it is slow on startup and taking pictures but for the price and what it can do in water, this point and shoot camera is great!

Reviews.Title: Best Under water camera ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gigglesqt777
Reviews.Content: I just used this camera for my JAMAICA trip and it worked amazingly!!! I was suprised. Pictures so crisp and clear and amazing color. Captures all under water action. Extremely excellent camera! I would recomment this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Worked as advertised
Reviews.Author: Sedgwint
Reviews.Content: This camera was underwater with me for hours while I floated and still works perfectly.  This camera fell out of a basket of a moving bike and still works perfectly.  Very pleased so far.  Be careful when buying a spare battery. The manual is for 2 different models that use 2 different battery sizes.  This one uses an LI42B.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Android Matt
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Nassau and this camera worked great! It was used snorkeling, waterslides (at Atlantis Resort) and the pool and never encountered any problems. I think the secret with any waterproof camera is to thoroughly rinse and/or soak in fresh water after use in the ocean or pool. Overall I'm very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera and price paid are fantabulous!
Reviews.Author: cruiser
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Pictures taken are fantabulous in or out of water.  I did download an example of both type of pictures, in a previous review.

Reviews.Title: works well under water
Reviews.Author: larry williams
Reviews.Content: I know some people have complained about water leakage but I think that was operator error. My kids love theirs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera! I love the fact that I don't have to worry about getting it wet. I am a college swimmer and am constantly around water so this has been great. I also took it on spring break with me to PCB and I never had to worry about getting salt water on it. The only thing that bugs me some times is that it will take some blurry photos if you don't let it focus first. You have to press part way down on the button to let it focus and then push it all the way down.

Reviews.Title: The camera is exactly what you'll expect it to be
Reviews.Author: TheMadScientist
Reviews.Content: Good quality photos & video, even under water.  When its sunny out it can be really hard to see the screen, so that can make taking pictures difficult. I love the face recognition & there are settings to recognize cats & dogs faces as well so you can get a good shot of them if you can keep their attention! Easy to use, help function will take you through whatever you dont understand. Great quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Ana Rosales
Reviews.Content: The shipment arrived quickly, excellent I recommend. Just yesterday the camera use and has many functions. I would try On The Water. THANKS FOR EVERYTHING...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera....
Reviews.Author: Eagle USA "Claudia"
Reviews.Content: Good product and high quality. Easy to use , resistant , waterproof.It has several features they've found awesome and helpful.This is my second camera of the Stylus Tough series.

Reviews.Title: Boa compra
Reviews.Author: Eduardo - Brasil
Reviews.Content: Máquina muito boa, fácil de usar, fotos ótimas embaixo d'água. Poderia vir com acessórios como capa, pulseira flutuante e cartão de memória. Estou satisfeito com a compra.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof!!
Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: I took the camera to Maui recently and hoping I could take some underwater pictures with the kids.  It worked all fine for the first 2 days (I rinsed and dried the camera as instructed after each use) and on my third day the camera suddenly stopped working.  When I took it out from the pool and I could see water inside the viewfinder and the lens. It was quite disappointing as the camera would fail this quickly.

Reviews.Title: Dashed lines at bottom of screen
Reviews.Author: paul vo
Reviews.Content: I just bought the camera about a week ago.  The screen has a dashed line near the bottom.  I cant seem to to get rid of it.  It works fine otherwise.  The battery life seems quite short.  I can only take about 75 pictures before it is out.

Reviews.Title: very nice little camera
Reviews.Author: W_tulip
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my upcoming trip to Bahias de Huatulco where I was planning to do some snorkeling and wanted to take pictures and videos. Overall it is a very nice little camera, compact, easy to use, has image stabilizer and takes vibrant sharp pictures in the water and out of it. it seems that underwater videos look better than still photos. It is very easy to switch between still photo and video. The battery lasts between 2.5 and 3 hours when the camera is continually used so I was glad I purchased additional battery.The reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is that this camera does not float nor does it come with a detachable buoy or something. I was looking forward to sharing my awesome vacation pics and videos with family, alas the camera drowned (!). On the last day of the trip I was getting on the boat after snorkeling and put the camera on the deck. It has slipped and drowned taking ALL of my vacation mementos with it (I wasn't smart enough to use multiple memory cards:(I liked the cam so much that I am considering purchasing a replacement. I will purchase a detachable flotation device for it though.

Reviews.Title: Worked well!
Reviews.Author: BDS
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a cruise and the cam and video worked well in and out of water. Just wish it had a bit more zoom!

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? Maybe. Camera? Definitely not.
Reviews.Author: R. Attila "If honest work and justice are not...
Reviews.Content: I had an old Panasonic Lumix that someone gave me for free cos it was banged up and didn't work properly. After a bit of TLC, I got it working and it served me beautifully for the last 4 years. 2 months ago it died finally. Decided to buy this Tough TG-310, cos it seemed like it could take a bit of punishment and still survive.I have not yet tested this thing in any challenging conditions, all I've done is take photos and videos. Extremely disappointed with the quality of the HD videos. Very grainy for 720p, if my old Lumix was 10/10, then this would be no more than 3/10.The photos are acceptable if the conditions are right, but it's very disapointing that if I want to make acceptable quality videos, I need to use my bulky Camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Can't compare to canon or nikon!
Reviews.Author: Leslie N. Stormes
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I'm usually taking picture mountain biking, skiing, kayaking, surfing, swimming or hiking. I thought it would be good to have a camera tough enough to survive my adventures. Well it might be freeze, shock and waterproof but it takes terrible pictures. Nothing like any of the canon's I've had. I think you could have the shakes and get a sharp picture with a canon this camera however even using a tripod my pictures were fuzzy. It's will be the last time I ever by a non canon or nikon camera. There is a reason why those are the only 2 companies that make professional camera. They know what they are doing. I thought I could save myself a few bucks with this but no such luck. it's going back!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Henderdad
Reviews.Content: My brother has a much fancier version of this camera which he takes great pictures with.  So when last Christmas rolled around, and plans for Washington DC in the spring, this camera was an obvious choice for my two kids.  The camera is fully automatic to fully manual with everything in between.  It has lots of other features.  I miss the viewfinder, but I am old school (D)SLR trained and experienced for years and years.  My kids who were 13 and 17 took great pictures while at DC.  Both kids have dropped their cameras from hip pocket height to concert, and both have had them in water with no adverse consequences. Both kids actually took pictures by putting their cameras in water fountains with rather good results.  (Darn kids!)  The only problem that has arose was while at DC my son carried his camera in his picket with keys and change.  The view screen now as a scuff mark about 1/8 by 3/8 inches in one corner.  I have not been able to buff it out.  Otherwise, great cameras.

Reviews.Title: Flop!! it didn't work first time I use it unederneath the water.
Reviews.Author: cora
Reviews.Content: Flop!!! It didn't work underneath the water. Instead get busted first time I use it underneath the water, I'm returning it. Very disappointed. I missed all underneath views , corals and all living creatures of the beautiful beaches.

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Odiggity.
Reviews.Content: Can't complain, I have to say you aren't going to get the underwater quality you may expect. The light under water is just not good enough for awesome pictures.Granted this got the job done up to 50ft deep when we went scuba diving, much better than no camera at all! However, I expected better picture quality. I can't dock Olympus stars for something that isn't their fault, I shouldn't have expected what I did from this style of simple camera.The picture quality is typical of other similarly priced point and shoot cameras, much better when dry =). Overall a good buy, glad we had it with us on the Honeymoon to brave the elements and "adventure".

Reviews.Title: Worthless piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Sylvie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as we both love waterproof cameras and this camera is able to go underwater a little bit, awesome.  i had previously accidentally destroyed her old waterproof camera on our trip to Maui by diving too deep with it (woops) so i thought this would be a great replacement as long as i didn't screw up again.it worked for a few months, the pictures were never a good quality.  on our trips to San Diego and San Francisco we both agreed that we would much rather use our iphones to take pictures as they actually were showing better quality.a month or two later and the camera will not turn on.  no idea why, we didn't drop it or anything.  we thought it may be the battery, but the battery works in my older fujifilm camera (not waterproof).  so thanks Olympus.  your camera blows.even before it died, i would have given it maybe 2.5 stars simply because it was working under water.  but seriously, even when it did work the picture quality was fairly poor.  though i will say that i did love the panoramic setting (though it was very difficult to hold absolutely steady if there's wind, so the pictures weren't very good there either because you have to keep it 100% level).  whatever.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA (unless it's on sale for like $15 and it's for your kid to mess around with in a pool).

Reviews.Title: Great Disposable Camera
Reviews.Author: stacy l. mixon
Reviews.Content: I received this camera in Mid June. By Mid August, it was done. I enjoyed the use of this camera while snorkeling 2 days a week for 2 months until it no longer worked. I would say a little over $100 is worth the investment for a disposable camera that only lasts 60 days. I sent the camera back to Olympus- they said the camera was unable to be repaired. Olympus offered a link (generous) to some refurbished disposable cameras much like the one that is now inoperable for 2x the $$. I say, fool me once...I had ordered an extra battery, b/c battery life is about 2 hours. Guess I'll be sending that back, too.

Reviews.Title: Olympus TG-310 Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Kimmie
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 17 year old daughter. She loves it. She has taken it to summer camp. It has been in the lake, the pool, and hiking. It is tough. Everyone has passed it around and used it. It works great.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2.  Both failed in short order.
Reviews.Author: TEXAS ZO6
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these within days of each other. The first one never worked (right out of the box). The second on lasted 5-months before it went haywire. Dealing with Olympus to get them repaired was quite cumbersome. Maybe I just got 2 lemons. But, I would never buy again.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? Hah! (UPDATED)
Reviews.Author: Daniel C. Starr
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 9/29/12: Olympus did replace the camera. I notice the new one delivers a much firmer "click" when closed and latched, so perhaps the hinge was loose on the first one. The replacement camera also came with a sheet of specific tips for keeping it watertight (oddly, not from Olympus themselves, but from a private person's website). I will add this bit of advice: if you are going to camp out in a damp, warm environment, bring a bag of rice. Stick the camera into the rice while recharging--I think it is a characteristic of this camera that if it's opened in a warm, humid environment, and then exposed to cooler temperatures when in use (say, when splashed with cold river water while canoeing), it will develop condensation inside.In any case, on a repeat of the kayaking trip that caused the first camera to mist up badly, the replacement item stayed watertight. So apparently it is a waterproof camera after all... unless you're unlucky enough to get one that isn't waterproof. That leaves the issue that it's still a fairly mediocre point-and-shoot camera. It starts up and responds slowly (don't expect to get candid shots with it), the auto-exposure is easily fooled by haze in the air, glare off water, or (apparently, when trying to shoot twisty-road video on the motorcycle) hot asphalt pavement, which shows up a blinding white (oddly enough, asphalt comes out dark gray when it's cool--is the camera seeing into the infrared?). It desperately needs a polarizing filter for any kind of around-the-water use, but none are made (time for ductape and cheap sunglasses, I guess).So, overall, a pretty ordinary point-and-shoot with that can be waterproof if you're careful. I upgraded the review to three stars on this basis.--- my original review ollows ---If it were truly waterproof, this would be a... fairly ordinary point-and-shoot digital camera, a bit slow to boot, a bit slow to record an image, a bit awkward to zoom (the buttons are hard to work and it tends to overshoot), a bit clumsy to change settings (you have to go through a lot of button presses to change things that would be a quick turn of a knob on another camera), and a bit less picture quality than you'd expect from 14 megapixels and 780p. But, it would be worth it to get a ruggedized, waterproof camera in this price range.Alas, this camera isn't waterproof. It's not even weatherproof, in the sense that it can't even tolerate the splashing that occurs during a canoe trip on a class 1 river (class 1 is one notch up from dead calm, for those not into whitewater terminology). Twenty minutes into its first use in the boat, the display, flash and (most important) lens window were fogging up on the inside. Two days later they are still fogged.The camera shop where I bought this item (I'd intended to buy in on Amazon, but they offered to match price) says it's 6-to-8 weeks to fix it... assuming Olympus will fix the thing (my past experience with the Olympus warranty department is that they view any problem as proof that you must have violated the terms of the warranty in some way). So much for capturing summer fun in the water... not that I'm going to trust it when it comes back, anyway. Once bitten twice shy and all that. Back to the disposable waterproof film cameras, I guess... they don't take movies and you have to wait for prints, but at least they usually don't leak.

Reviews.Title: Average Camera that is not EFFICTIVELY waterproof
Reviews.Author: G. Bennett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to record a snorkeling vacation in HI.  I read all the reviews, including the cautions about the need to insure a clean seal, and thought I could be careful enough.  Wrong in spades.The camera worked well enough on land.  I used it several times in both still and video with acceptable, if not great results.  During our first snorkel it worked pretty well.  I got some videos and stills that were serviceable, but again not great.  I did not open the camera until I was back at the condo.  I rinsed and dried it before opening.  Then I cleaned the seal carefully with dry cotton swabs.  I allowed everything to air dry completely while open, then again went over the seal area with a microfiber cloth to remove any lingering debris or dust.  It worked fine.  The next snorkel trip I got three stills and it died.  When I got back there was water inside (salt, of course).  The camera is totally dead.If you want a waterproof, this one WILL die sooner or later, and most likely sooner, especially if you open and close the case during non-water usage.As a camera, the unit is just acceptable.  The color is good but the exposure settings seem off.  You cannot both zoom AND have audio in video mode.  One or the other.  On the good side, I liked the interface.  Easy to understand and change settings.Overall, this is a poor choice for just about any purpose.  The shock resistance feature is about the only reason I can think of to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't that great..
Reviews.Author: Brit
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a X-Mas present. I loved the look of it and especially the bright red color. That's the first thing that attracted me to the camera! I was thinking I was going to get a nice, cheaper, waterproof camera for my boyfriend. The reviews said it was great, took great pictures, why wouldn't I buy right?? Wrong, it took crap pictures. Even when the people were standing completely still the pictures weren't clear when blown up on the computer. I returned it and got a different camera that seems to be working a lot better. We used to have an Olympus Stylus but when we took it into the ocean it stopped working. Maybe it's time to stop buying Olympus????

Reviews.Title: Waterproof???
Reviews.Author: Leslie Kann
Reviews.Content: I took pictures before it got wet and they were decent enough.  But after one dip in the water, there was clearly water inside the camera and I eeked out about 8 foggy shots before it shut down completely.  What a waste of money.  Do NOT take a chance on this one!!!  I missed some great shots of a lifetime trusting the Olympus name.  It's going back ----I used to LOVE Olympus, but this has put me off.

Reviews.Title: Bad Focus
Reviews.Author: Felipe
Reviews.Content: This camera can be good, but the focus doesn't work in closed ambients, I had a bad experience with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: This book came in as I had expected it too be as well as on time! Very happy with this purchase!!
